availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Richard D. Walker (Greenup County, Kentucky, farm laborer)

body.p: Greenup County, Kentucky, farm laborer. Kentucky native. Son of Robert Walker and Margaret Walker. Married to Rachel Bush Walker on November 10, 1853. Father of Mary A. Walker, John F. Walker, and Margaret Walker. Farmer in Greenup County in 1850. Farm laborer in Greenup County in 1860.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, District 1, p. 225. Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, p. 111. Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Greenup County, Precinct 2, p. 13. Scioto County, Ohio Marriages, 1851-60, Portsmouth, Ohio, accessed via Jordan Dodd, comp., _Ohio, Marriages, 1803-1900, Ancestry. Find A Grave, "Richard D Walker (1829-1908)," Memorial #23957096, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/23957096/richard-d-walker (accessed June 15, 2017).
